docurama.title: Docurama
docurama.description: Offers access to award-winning documentaries, films and TV series and presents a curated selection of the most impactful true-life stories.

22231.title: Amargosa
22231.description: Set in the remote California ghost town of Death Valley Junction, this Emmy award-winning documentary captures artist and dancer Marta Becket's 33 year quest for self expression.

22233.title: Awful Normal
22233.description: Molested by a family friend when they were both too young to understand, filmmaker Celesta Davis and her sister Karen now seek resolution with their effort to track him down and ask the question that's haunted them both for 25 years: "Why?"

22238.title: Cinematographer Style
22238.description: CINEMATOGRAPHER STYLE celebrates the passion, dedication, and art of the men and women who make movies look the way they do.

22260.title: Note By Note
22260.description: Featuring famed pianists such as Harry Connick, Jr. and Lang Lang, Note by Note follows the year-long, hand-crafted creation of a Steinway concert grand piano from forest floor to concert hall.

22267.title: Secrecy
22267.description: Through interviews with reporters, former CIA agents, and everyday citizens, this acclaimed film explores the world of government secrecy and the tensions between our safety as a nation and our ability to function as a democracy.

22269.title: Sister Helen
22269.description: Brash, foul-mouthed, and no-nonsense, Sister Helen is a recovering alcoholic who lost her husband and sons to substance abuse. She single-handedly fights her own war on drugs as director of a halfway house for recovering addicts in NYC's South Bronx.

22270.title: Strange Culture
22270.description: In this moving and wildly innovative film, director Lynn Hershman Leeson tells the terrifying true story of how one man's personal tragedy turns into persecution by a paranoid and overzealous government.

22272.title: The Age Of Stupid
22272.description: The year is 2055. The Earth is devastated. One man, Oscar nominee Pete Postlethwaite, remains to archive humanity and review all the warnings projected by current, mainstream science.

28195.title: The Yes Men Fix the World
28195.description: Two didactic pranksters known as the Yes Men - Andy Bichlbaum and Mike Bonanno - employ monkey business to highlight the political and economic shenanigans surrounding ecological catastrophes like the Union Carbide disaster in India.

56919.title: Which Way Home
56919.description: This Academy Award nominated film shows the personal side of immigration through the eyes of children who face harrowing dangers with enormous courage and resourcefulness as they endeavor to make it form Mexico to the United States.

136040.title: Junior
136040.description: Eddie Belasco is a 75-year-old Italian-American who seems to have jumped from the pages of a Scorsese script, except he lives with his 98-year-old mother, Josephine. Luckily, their senses of humor match their levels of irritability. Together they fight and laugh in equal measures as the difficulties of aging and living in a changing neighborhood catch up with them. Eddie was always one to love the limelight, trying his hand at acting and managing topless female rock bands and now running a non-profit theatre group for young people. In the meantime, the spotlight is squarely on Josephine, with the local press running to her as she finally gets her high school diploma. Acclaimed cinematographer Jenna Rosher deftly captures the bond between this odd couple, and crafts a hilarious and touching portrait of growing old while staying young. After this you will be unable to resist the urge to hug the closest mother you can find.

146672.title: Drivers Wanted
146672.description: Drivers Wanted reveals the impossibly eclectic community inhabiting a taxi garage in Queens, New York. The documentary takes the viewer into the taxi seat to experience accidents, blizzards, and the late night streets of NYC.

146680.title: Reveal the Path
146680.description: Reveal the Path is a genre-defying adventure film that contemplates what it means to live an inspired life using the bicycle as a mechanism to explore, dream and discover. Meet locals living modest yet seemingly fulfilling lives, leading us to question what it means to live an inspired life - however humble or extravagant.

146692.title: CoSM the Movie: Alex Grey and the Chapel of Sacred Mirrors
146692.description: OSM is an invitation to personal reflection, growth, and harmony, leading spiritual adventurers on a journey into the visionary art cosmos of world-renowned artist Alex Grey.

146700.title: Music From The Inside Out
146700.description: Oscar-nominated filmmaker Daniel Anker spent five years with the Philadelphia Orchestra crafting this fascinating documentary uncovering a human side to the magic of making music.

146702.title: Nobelity
146702.description: A look at the world's biggest problems through the eyes of Nobel laureates, filmmaker Turk Pipkin sets out to find answers about the kind of world our children will know.

146705.title: On Any Sunday
146705.description: A documentary following the lives of motorcycle racers and racing enthusiasts, including actor Steve McQueen.

146706.title: One Peace at a Time
146706.description: A film about a messed up world and how to fix it. Sprinkled with music, this documentary lyrically weaves a tapestry through 20 countries and is as magical as it is informative.

148988.title: They Call It Myanmar: Lifting The Curtain
148988.description: This film provides a rare look at the second-most isolated country on the planet - Burma.

149147.title: Fly Fishing Film Tour 2013
149147.description: 2013 Fly Fishing Film Tour is a collection of the best short form films on Fly Fishing. Includes additional films not seen in the theater.

154308.title: China and the Forbidden City
154308.description: The first Westerner to ever film inside communist China was Lucy Jarvis. Her unique blend of journalism and filmmaking brings us a look at the mystery of the city of Peking.

154320.title: Men With Beards
154320.description: In this strange tale of beauty and brotherhood, everyday men with serious beards share their opinions on identity and self-expression.

154325.title: On Any Sunday Motocross, Malcolm & More
154325.description: This film includes unseen footage created for the greatest film in the history of motor sport, while filmmaker Bruce Brown revisits Malcolm Smith and other great Motocross riders.

154326.title: On Any Sunday Revisited
154326.description: In On Any Sunday Revisited, Bruce Brown creates another classic, featuring the sport's greatest riders as they look back on the movie that changed their lives.

154328.title: Random Lunacy
154328.description: This vibrant documentary follows free-spirited nomad Poppa Neutrino as he roves the planet by land and sea, making up his life as he goes along.

154336.title: Virtual JFK
154336.description: Virtual JFK takes up one of America's controversial "what if" scenarios, examining the question: Would the U.S. have escalated the war in Vietnam if Kennedy was not assassinated?

154337.title: Trained in the Ways of Men
154337.description: Explores the events surrounding the shocking 2002 murder of 17-year-old Gwen Araujo after her four attackers discovered she was transgender.

157790.title: Fly Fishing Film Tour 2011
157790.description: This year's tour stopped at 110 different locations and included many events at local fly shops, which gave people the chance to learn more about their local fishing opportunities.

157791.title: Fly Fishing Film Tour 2012
157791.description: This year's tour stopped at 110 different locations and included many events at local fly shops, which gave people the chance to learn more about their local fishing opportunities.

168336.title: Ladies & Gentlemen...Mr. Leonard Cohen
168336.description: An engaging and informal portrait catches the imaginative energies of a youthful Leonard Cohen, the quicksilver poet, novelist and songwriter.

168340.title: Life With Murder
168340.description: A mother and father are forced to make the most unthinkable decision of their lives when their daughter is killed and their son is the prime suspect.

168345.title: Outbreak: Anatomy of a Plague
168345.description: Explore the course that a smallpox epidemic in modern-day Montreal would take in juxtaposition with the 1885 epidemic in Montreal.

168356.title: The Strangest Dream
168356.description: Retrace the history of nuclear weapons, from the first test in New Mexico, to Hiroshima, where we meet survivors of the first atomic attack.

168358.title: The Coca-Cola Case
168358.description: Directors Gutierrez and Garcia present a searing indictment of the Coca-Cola empire and its alleged kidnapping, torture and murder of union leaders.

168383.title: Earth Keepers
168383.description: The innovative projects developed by the planetary visionaries Mikael Rioux meets are a survival guide and source of hope to the problems faced by our planet.

169474.title: Adventures in Plymptoons!
169474.description: Go deep inside the method and madness of America's most independent animator, Bill Plympton, creatively incubated in his hometown of Portland, Oregon.

169480.title: BlueGreen
169480.description: From the physiological to the spiritual, explore the power of the ocean and how it affects our lives and why are all attracted to it in one way or another.

169499.title: The Forgotten Bomb
169499.description: Join filmmaker Bud Ryan on an epic journey to discover what the bomber can learn from the bombed and what the true state of the nuclear threat is today.

169519.title: The Mexican Suitcase
169519.description: The incredible discovery of thousands of negatives of the Spanish Civil War provides a window into that war's ongoing trauma in this exquisite documentary.

169535.title: Robert Williams Mr. Bitchin'
169535.description: This intimate profile of artist Robert Williams' and his painstakingly detailed work that featured naked women, death, destruction, booze and clowns.

176386.title: Beatles Stories
176386.description: Songwriter Seth Swirsky grew up loving the Beatles. In 2004, he set out, video camera in hand, to talk to people who had crossed paths with his heroes.

189464.title: Derailroaded
189464.description: A shocking and sensitive journey through the life and music of manic-depressive, paranoid-schizophrenic, cult music icon Wild Man Fischer.

189465.title: Flyin' Cut Sleeves
189465.description: Portrait of the lives of street gang presidents in the Bronx over a 20-year period.

189468.title: Hubert Selby Jr: It'll Be Better Tomorrow
189468.description: A harrowing exploration into the life and art of the renowned author Hubert Selby Jr., who described himself as "a scream looking for a mouth."

189471.title: The Everglades: A Subtropical Paradise
189471.description: There is no place on the planet like the Everglades "a place where two great biomes of life meet: the tropical and the temperate mid-latitude.

189473.title: The Black Hills and the Badlands: Gateway to the West
189473.description: Nestled in the heart of America's Great Plains are the distinct and sacred landscapes that beckon the visitor to enter the nation's glorious West.

189482.title: Sixteen Days In China: A Documentary By Martin Atkins
189482.description: Martin Atkins documents his 2006 trip to Beijing, China, where he recorded the cream of the Beijing music scene crop.

191278.title: Great Smoky Mountains: Crown Jewel of the Appalachians
191278.description: Explore acres of breathtaking beauty: glorious waterfalls, pristine mountain streams and one of the most biologically diverse ecosystems in the world.

191279.title: Yellowstone: The World's First National Park
191279.description: Explore the majesty and history behind the creation of the world's first national park, Yellowstone.

191280.title: Yosemite: The High Sierras
191280.description: The Sierra Nevada mountain range is truly spectacular in every sense of the word. Enjoy breath-taking aerial views as you soar over its majesty.

191281.title: Voyageurs: Spirit of the Boundary Waters
191281.description: Experience the indigenous spirit and beauty that nature holds in this magnificent journey through Voyageurs National Park.

191771.title: Opening Our Eyes
191771.description: An inspiring "and riveting "99 day journey, telling the story of 11 Americans on six continents who are "in the trenches" changing the world. Like Maggie (23) from New Jersey who used her savings to built a children's home in Nepal. Multiple awards.

226595.title: Steal This Film
226595.description: A captivating account of the prominent players in the Swedish (copyright infringement) piracy culture.

252478.title: The Will Of Victory
252478.description: A notorious war documentary containing never before seen footage from WWII and the Nazi invasion. Emotionally fierce and astonishingly unique, the footage (now in color) paints a startling landscape of the horrors of war and the power of human resilience.

299835.title: For A Song
299835.description: Welcome to the magnificent yet unheralded world of choral music. A world inhabited by exceptional beings who have the capacity to experience joy from a single musical note.

299838.title: Inuuvunga - I Am Inuk, I Am Alive
299838.description: Hockey, hip hop and midnight Ski-Doo rides. Welcome to Inukjuak. Acting as filmmakers, eight Inuit teens offer a contemporary view of life in Canadas North, offering a sharp account of coming of age in a time of confusion and cultural dislocation.

299843.title: Salt
299843.description: These provocative 20-minute movies made by high school students provide an insider's look at youth culture.

299844.title: Salvation
299844.description: Meet some front-line soldiers of the Salvation Army-a group of vibrant young workers at a homeless shelter-and get a glimpse of what motivates them.

299847.title: Soraida, a Woman of Palestine
299847.description: In Soraida's neighbourhood, the women do not all wear veils, the men do not rattle off political slogans and the young people do not strap bombs to their belts. Despite the burden of curfews and checkpoints, life goes on in Ramallah.

299848.title: Through These Eyes
299848.description: In the 1960s, an elementary school program entitled Man: A Course of Study looked to the Inuit of the Canadian Arctic to help American students see their own society in a new way.

299849.title: The Tree That Remembers
299849.description: In 1992 a young Iranian student hanged himself from a tree in a small Ontario town. Having escaped the Ayatollahs regime and found a new home in Canada, he could not escape his past.

304072.title: War Hospital
304072.description: A visit to the world's largest field hospital

310498.title: Hot Coffee
310498.description: We explore how the infamous McDonald's hot coffee lawsuit sparked a big business propaganda and tort reform campaign, weakening civil justice.

310501.title: Superheroes
310501.description: What if superheroes were real? Meet the real-life, self-proclaimed crime fighters who don masks and capes and attempt to bring justice to evildoers.

312524.title: The World Before Her
312524.description: Two young women find themselves on divergent paths in modern India - one wants to model, and the other is a radical ready to kill for her beliefs.

312529.title: Price for Peace
312529.description: This powerful film chronicles the events in the Pacific theater of WWII, from the bombing of Pearl Harbor to the American occupation of Japan in 1945.

312537.title: Hell and Back Again
312537.description: Photojournalist Danfung Dennis reveals the devastating impact a Taliban bullet has on the life of 25-year-old U.S. Marine Sergeant Nathan Harris.

312542.title: Somewhere Between
312542.description: In profiling Chinese adoptees in contemporary America, this documentary illustrates that even the most specific of experiences can be universally relatable.

312543.title: Marjoe
312543.description: This Oscar-winning documentary chronicles the story of a firebrand evangelical preacher who wholeheartedly and humorously exposes himself as a fraud.

312545.title: Last Call at the Oasis
312545.description: A meditation on Earth's most valuable resource, water, and how its scarcity is leading to a global shortage that threatens all life on this planet.

312560.title: Genghis Blues
312560.description: A blind, self-taught U.S. musician travels to Siberia to explore the seemingly impossible art of Tuvan throat singing with other practitioners.

312561.title: My Trip to Al-Qaeda
312561.description: Acclaimed documentarian Alex Gibney chronicles journalist Lawrence Wright's struggle to maintain his objectivity while writing about Islamic terror.

312569.title: They Came To Play
312569.description: At the Outstanding Amateurs Piano Competition, adult nonprofessional pianists from all over the world come together for a chance to shine onstage.

312576.title: A Small Act
312576.description: Years after an act of kindness changed his life, a Harvard grad from rural Kenya tracks down the Swedish stranger who sponsored his education.

312578.title: The Kids Grow Up
312578.description: Parenting is a two-way street for Doug Block and his college-bound daughter, Lucy, in this affectionate doc about modern families and empty nests.

312588.title: Fresh
312588.description: This stirring call to action outlines the vicious cycle of industrial agriculture while celebrating the people working to reinvent our food system.

312590.title: Dirt! The Movie
312590.description: This eye-opening look at the ground beneath our feet explores how repairing our relationship with dirt can create new possibilities for life on Earth.

317303.title: Adventures of the Penguin King
317303.description: Rex, a young King Penguin, has been away from his home for three years, learning to hunt in the deep oceans, but now he's back - in Penguin City. His mission: to find a mate, settle down and raise a chick - to become a true Penguin King.

319697.title: Birth Story: Ina May Gaskin and the Farm Midwives
319697.description: Birth Story: Ina May Gaskin and the Farm Midwives tells the story of counterculture heroine Ina May Gaskin and her spirited friends, who began delivering each other's babies in 1970, on a caravan of hippie school buses, headed to a patch of rural Tennessee land. With Ina May as their leader, the women taught themselves midwifery from the ground up, and became an integral part of a new, entirely communal, agricultural society called The Farm. The people of The Farm grew their own food, built their own houses, published their own books, and, as word of their social experiment spread, created a model of care for women and babies that changed a generation's approach to childbirth. Forty years ago, Ina May led the charge away from isolated hospital birthing rooms, where husbands were not allowed and mandatory forceps deliveries were the norm. Today, as nearly one third of all US babies are born via C-section, she fights to preserve her community's hard-won knowledge. With incredible access to the midwives' archival video collection, the film not only captures the unique sisterhood at The Farm Clinic--from its heyday into the present--but shows childbirth the way most people have never seen it--unadorned, unabashed, and awe-inspiring.

319700.title: The Big Picture
319700.description: The Big Picture: Rethinking Dyslexia provides personal and uplifting accounts of the dyslexic experience from children, experts and iconic leaders, such as Sir Richard Branson and financier Charles Schwab. Directed by James Redford, the film not only clears up the misconceptions about the condition, but also paints a picture of hope for all who struggle with it. Proving that dyslexia is a neurological issue and not a character flaw, The Big Picture beautifully illustrates that while the condition is an obstacle, it also carries some unique advantages, and ultimately can be overcome.

319921.title: The Carrier
319921.description: When 28-year-old Mutinta Mweemba first shares all the hopes and dreams she once nurtured as a child, her aspirations seem no different from those of many other young women around the world. She dreams of meeting and falling in love with a handsome man, being married and raising children and hopefully one day providing those children with a better life than her own. But Mutinta's dreams were never realized. Her soft-spoken husband came with two other wives, and the remote Zambian village that she calls home is being ravaged by a deadly new epidemic - a mysterious disease called “AIDS.” Set against the backdrop of today's most urgent plague, Maggie Betts's The Carrier is a stunning portrait of both a family and a community caught in a desperate struggle to emancipate their next generation from AIDS. As all the adults in her marriage, including Mutinta, soon discover that they are afflicted with HIV, tensions within the household threaten to tear her family apart and the fragile love between a husband and wife finds itself challenged. All the while Mutinta also learns that she's become pregnant again, her quest to the save her baby from her disease, becomes the family's last hope for redemption. In its breathtaking visuals and unique lyrical style, The Carrier is a story of hope and renewal, of love and dignity, told through the eyes of an increasingly determined young heroine who refuses to be overwhelmed by the forces that surround her. It is an inspiring and emotional testament to today's modern Africa and proud people struggling not only to understand and make sense of, but also persevere and overcome what has happened to their world.

339387.title: It Happened Here
339387.description: It Happened Here is a feature length documentary about the alarming pervasiveness of sexual assault on college campuses, the impact on the student, their family and institution, and the burgeoning movement of student survivors coming forth and taking action against their schools on campus and in federal court. Through the personal portraits of five students at three schools, testimonials from college administrators, educators, mental health experts and legal scholars, It Happened Here breaks the silence surrounding campus sexual violence and asks why is this happening? What are schools doing about it? What is “rape culture” and what can we do to prevent campus assault?

372430.title: Closure
372430.description: Raised by a white couple in a large, multiracial family in Washington State, a Black woman searching for answers sets out to find her birth family.

377074.title: I'm Fine, Thanks
377074.description: "I'm Fine, Thanks" follows a documentary crew of 5 around the United States as they interview everyday people on how they got trapped in complacent, dull lives and careers - and the steps they took to change their lives forever. Told through a collection of intimate, hilarious and at times heartbreaking stories from a cross section of America, "I'm Fine, Thanks" is a 'coming of age' movie for the already 'of age.' It's a rallying cry for personal empowerment and a wake-up call to anyone who is driving through life asleep at the wheel. Stars noted empowerment writers Chris Guillebeau and Man vs. Debt guru Adam C. Baker.

384478.title: The Art of McCartney
384478.description: An iconic songwriter and performer, Paul McCartney has been providing the soundtrack to millions of peoples lives for over half a century. This documentary explores the making of a remarkable album: The Art of McCartney features the finest artists of today paying their respect to the greatest. In this film you are going to hear from some of the artists who shaped The Art of McCartney, sharing their thoughts about Paul's music and the songs they have recorded.

384479.title: Power Trip
384479.description: AES Corp., the massive American "global power company," has purchased the privatized electricity distribution company in Tbilisi, capital of the former Soviet Republic of Georgia. AES manager Piers Lewis must now train the formerly communist populace that, in this new world, customers pay for their electricity. The Georgians meanwhile, from pensioners to the Energy Minister, devise ever more clever ways to get it free.  Amidst hot tempers and high drama, Lewis balances his love for the Georgian people with the hardships his company creates for them, as they struggle to build a nation from the rubble of Soviet collapse.

401754.title: First Degree
401754.description: The expression, “sent up the river,” was coined by convicts who were sent up the Hudson River to do their time at the infamous Sing Sing Prison in Ossining, NY. First Degree finds hope in this seemingly hopeless place by investigating an unusual college behind bars that prevents Sing Sing inmates from being sent back up the river after their release. First Degree takes viewers inside this notorious maximum security prison and introduces them to a cast of unforgettable inmates. One charismatic prisoner is Jermaine Archer, whose reputation changed from being a feared gang leader to being a role model for students attending college at Sing Sing.Another is Clarence Maclin, who got his college degree shortly before being paroled and now works as a supervisor at a nearby residential treatment program helping young people avoid the costly mistakes he made as a teenager.Perhaps the most remarkable character is Sean Pica, who served 16 years for murder, but unlike most paroled inmates who quickly reoffend and return to prison, Sean came back to run Sing Sing’s college program. Nationwide, over half of released inmates return to prison within 5 years, but for the past 14 years, less than 1% of the inmates that received a college degree at Sing Sing returned to prison.

405158.title: No Tomorrow
405158.description: After a subject of a 2004 documentary about teens in the foster system is murdered, the film becomes a key piece of evidence in the killer's trial.

410028.title: Ping Pong
410028.description: A twinkly inspirational documentary about eight competitors in the World Over-80 Table Tennis Championships in Inner Mongolia. The ping-pongers are all in their 80s and 90s; one Australian woman is a centurion. Most of the players have been athletes all their lives, but one German woman only took the sport up as an octogenarian after suffering a stroke. The sport seems to have re-energized her. The film shows that the advanced masters scene is like those in other sports, with rivalries, egomania and even dirty tricks -- like stealing an opponent's bat. Losing doesn't get any less painful with age.

458535.title: Dream On
458535.description: Newly unemployed comedian John Fugelsang speaks to struggling people across the country to see whether the American Dream is still alive.

458776.title: A Bond Unbroken
458776.description: When Navy SEALS reunite 40 years after serving in Vietnam, they search for their combat interpreter, who was left behind in the aftermath of war.

458785.title: Under the Turban
458785.description: A 9-year old Sikh embarks on a quest across many countries with his family to learn more about their religion by visiting diverse Sikh communities.

458790.title: Injecting Aluminum
458790.description: A documentary about a disease found in some French patients in the early 1990s, brought on by injected aluminum enzymes found in their muscle tissue.

458794.title: The First American
458794.description: A documentary on America’s first President, George Washington, from ideas of self-government and the American Revolution to creating the Constitution.

458795.title: The UnAmerican Struggle
458795.description: The rise of bigotry in America is shown by a cross-section of activists describing the renewed struggle against intolerance faced by minorities today.

458797.title: Generation Baby Buster
458797.description: A documentary by a female director looking to explore the many reasons why so many women of a new generation are choosing not to have children.

458805.title: yHomeless
458805.description: A filmmaker facing foreclosure travels across the country, living out of his car and learning what it's like to be homeless in America.

458876.title: Message From Hiroshima
458876.description: A documentary that recreates sights, sounds, and tales of Hiroshima’s thriving life and culture just before it vanished with the first atomic bomb.

458885.title: Haunters: The Art of the Scare
458885.description: The rise of terror as entertainment as seen through the growing sub-culture of extreme horror situations, beyond the haunted house and into reality.

458893.title: CODumentary
458893.description: With its innovative and cinematic design, Call of Duty brought multiplayer gaming to a whole new level, spawning a subculture of professional players.

458896.title: Dusty's Trail: Summit of Borneo
458896.description: A devastating diagnosis of Duchenne muscular dystrophy inspires one mother to scale Malaysia's highest peak to fight her son's deadly disease.

460035.title: See What I'm Saying: The Deaf Entertainers Documentary
460035.description: This multi-award winning documentary offers a rare and powerful glimpse into the lives of four extraordinarily talented Deaf entertainers (actor Robert DeMayo, singer TL Forsberg, drummer Bob Hiltermann, and comedian CJ Jones) as they strive to cross over into mainstream popular culture. Their intertwined and gripping stories bring to light the universal need to be seen. Director Hilari Scarl, whose involvement with the Deaf community began when she toured with the National Theatre of the Deaf, insightfully captures the many obstacles these performers face daily with equal measures of humor and emotion. The New York Times Critics' Pick calls it 'Complex, candid and all-but essential viewing for hearing audiences' and USA Today raves, "Hilari Scarl's powerful and moving film about the unsung community of deaf entertainers does something few documentaries accomplish - It takes us into a world we know little or nothing about and not only enlightens, but entertains. Scarl has captured the humor, heartbreak and pathos of a world we once viewed only from the outside, if at all.'The film traces a year in the lives of Bob Hiltermann, a drummer in the deaf rock band Beethoven's Nightmare, who produces the largest show in the band's 30 year history; CJ Jones (Baby Driver), an internationally-renowned comic in the Deaf community, who produces the first International Sign Language Festival in Los Angeles; Robert DeMayo (Sign With Robert), a brilliant actor who teaches at Juilliard while struggling to survive when he becomes homeless while living with HIV; and TL Forsberg (Switched at Birth), a hard of hearing singer who finds herself caught between the hearing world and the Deaf community when she attracts her first major producer to record her CD Not Deaf Enough. Chronicled with rare intimacy and candor, SEE WHAT I'M SAYING is open captioned, allowing the sign language and the spoken dialog to be equally accessible to both hearing and deaf viewers.

464103.title: Rising Tides
464103.description: Explores the topic of coastline erosion, showing what has been done in the past, what is being done now, what worked, what didn't and what the coastal areas can expect in the future.

464114.title: Mother Ocean
464114.description: Mother Ocean reflects the incredible bond between humans and underwater species.

464121.title: Trumping Democracy
464121.description: Donald Trump's stunning victory was engineered through a campaign of fake news and lies, funded by reclusive multi-billionaire Robert Mercer.

464172.title: Popaganda: The Art and Crimes of Ron English
464172.description: Acclaimed doc showcasing the "life and crimes" of guerilla artist Ron English.

464190.title: Ride Report: 10,000 Miles to Rio
464190.description: When filmmakers Tiernan Turner and Matt Kendall decide to go to the world famous Carnaval, they embark on a 10,000 mile, cross-continental road trip of a lifetime from Las Vegas to Rio de Janeiro on nothing but Suzuki motorcycles and the help of the burgeoning, international social network of adventure riders and couch-surfers.

464191.title: Narco Cultura
464191.description: Explores the beginnings of the controversial narcocorridos folk-music movement that glorifies the violent exploits of Mexican narco traffickers.

464292.title: I Am the Queen
464292.description: In Chicago's Humboldt Park neighborhood, the Vida/SIDA Cacica Pageant brings together members of the Puerto Rican community to celebrate its transgender participants. I Am The Queen follows Bianca, Julissa and Jolizza as they prepare for the pageant.

467870.title: SMART: Specialized Mobile Animal Rescue Team
467870.description: In the urban jungle of Los Angeles, a dedicated team of animal rescuers rush to the scene to save animals from an array of perilous situations.

475691.title: Global Junk Food
475691.description: A look into why, In Europe, responsibility pledges ban food manufacturers from using toxic ingredients and targeting kids, but not in other nations.

475694.title: Collusion
475694.description: An expose of the collusion between Loyalist paramilitaries and British security forces in Northern Ireland during the 30-year ‘Troubles’ conflict.

475695.title: Brand Irish
475695.description: The huge impact of Ireland’s brand drives this documentary about the tiny island with over 75 million people with some level of familial ties there.

475702.title: The Silent Teacher
475702.description: The deeper meaning of love, life, death and the afterlife are explored in this deeply moving documentary about donating one’s body to medical science.

555705.title: Wild Daze
555705.description: Shot in 9 countries, meet the wildlife experts, activists, and conservationists on the frontlines of the fight against the elephant poaching industry.

566046.title: The Blueberry Farmer
566046.description: The story of how Trace View Farm in the hills of Tennessee became a battleground against the federal government in the fight for medical marijuana.

566058.title: Harlem to Hollywood
566058.description: Born into a white suburban family, Billy Vera’s love for R&B began as a child and kicked off a songwriting career and a slew of Billboard hits.

571134.title: The First Boys of Spring
571134.description: A look at the unlikely origins of the annual rite that we now know as baseball spring training, circa 1886, in the Arkansas resort town of Hot Springs.

574315.title: El Boxeo
574315.description: This inspiring documentary explains how Latinos have overcome racism and other adversities to rise to greatness in the sport of boxing.

583473.title: Killing Beef
583473.description: A journalist shares his story of reconciling with his shooter and discusses dangers and systemic issues affecting the African-American community.

594357.title: A Voice From Mauthausen
594357.description: One of the first ‘frogmen’ in the Navy Reserve fights to survive missions behind enemy lines and his own capture at the Mauthausen concentration camp.

594370.title: On a Wing and a Prayer
594370.description: A Muslim American portfolio manager and son of a Pakistani commercial pilot eschews post-9/11 stereotypes as he attends a scrappy flight school.

594404.title: Inside Out
594404.description: A peaceful suburban neighborhood is thrown into paranoid chaos with the arrival of its new move-in: the strange and secretive shrink Dr. Peoples.

595077.title: Rivers and Tides
595077.description: In the timeless tradition of "Winged Migration" and "Koyaanisqatsi," the theatrical phenomenon RIVERS AND TIDES depicts the magical relationship between art and nature while painting a visually.

619256.title: Africa Speaks
619256.description: A fascinating look at daily life in Africa, featuring Ubangi women, a swarm of locusts, and amazing encounters with wildlife in the Congo.

619258.title: Adventures of Chico
619258.description: Without children to play with, young Chico spends his days in the Mexican desert where his encounters with its wildlife will change his life forever.

622385.title: Magic Pantonio
622385.description: Ascend the soaring heights of the muralist movement with profiles of the visual artists scaling skyscrapers to create their vertiginous masterpieces.

622388.title: The Opium War
622388.description: When the government in northern Myanmar failed to control the opium epidemic among its youth, civilians defied drug lords to create a rehab program.

629890.title: Pursuing Happiness
629890.description: Two filmmakers set out to better understand who the happiest people in America are through cross-country travels and insightful discussions.

629892.title: Intelligent Lives
629892.description: Chris Cooper narrates this doc, which chronicles the lives of young adults with intellectual disabilities who are working to challenge perceptions

629895.title: Selfless
629895.description: With emerging technology and the still yet uncharted results of social media, this documentary asks what’s next for the new generation.

629899.title: Sustainable
629899.description: A chilling look at America’s food system’s status today, and how economic and environmental instability puts further pressure on farmers.

630345.title: Olompali: A Hippie Odyssey
630345.description: A fascinating documentary about a wealthy California businessman who spent his wealth to create a grand hippie paradise that gradually became tragic.

630372.title: Becoming Animal
630372.description: An arthouse approach to the conventional nature documentary that peers into the so-called natural spaces where human beings and animals connect.

632555.title: Liyana
632555.description: Five Swazi orphans pool their imaginations to create a fairytale about a young girl who must embark on a dangerous quest to rescue her twin brothers.

670971.title: The Beatles: Scream and Shout
670971.description: In this story about the Beatles, original film is used to explore how the Beatles became successful with their first North American tour in 1964.

671611.title: Broken Vows: Stories of Separation
671611.description: A captivating documentary that steps into the shoes of women experiencing separation and who have been caught in the crossfire of marriage breakdown.

712062.title: Racing Extinction
712062.description: Covert activists work to expose how humanity’s footprint on the planet will lead to the loss of 50% of all species by the end of this century.

03490.title: Backstage Pass
03490.description: Experience Europe's biggest music festivals with the artists in this all-access docuseries that reveals what really goes on behind the scenes.

03555.title: 101 People Who Made the 20th Century
03555.description: Counting down the key figures of the 20th century, this series profiles the political leaders, scientists and artists who shaped the world today.

0881.title: The Man Show
0881.description: A prank, talk show aimed at men.

0300005856.title: MIX
0300005856.description: Join host Tamee Harrison as she takes viewers behind the bars of master mixologists to mix up one-of-a-kind craft cocktails.

0300006515.title: The Future Is Cannabis
0300006515.description: The Future Is Cannabis (T.F.I.C.) explores all aspects of the emerging Cannabis Industry. From farms to manufacturers to dispensaries to celebrity entrepreneurs; T.F.I.C.

0300006055.title: Infusion
0300006055.description: Take a deep dive beyond the recipes and into the soul of some of the most iconic South American cuisine staples and the cultures that shaped them.

0300006648.title: The Chuckie Perez Show
0300006648.description: This late-night variety talk show, hosted by Chuckie Perez, features a blend of family-friendly interviews, stand-up comedy, and musical guests.

0300006514.title: MIX Cocktail Hour
0300006514.description: MIX: Cocktail Hour is a fun, live mixology series featuring MIX host Tamee Harrison and MIX head barman Scott Cushman making unique craft cocktails in the MIX secret speakeasy bar.

0300007174.title: MEZCLA
0300007174.description: Host Tamee Harrison takes viewers on a VIP tour behind the high end bars where master mixologists concoct the most innovative, delicious and one-of-a-kind cocktails.
